verses.verse: When a man <S%H376><s%> takes <S%H3947><s%> a wife, <S%H802><s%> and marries <S%H1166><s%> her, <S%H4672><s%> then it shall be, if she find no favor <S%H2580><s%> in his eyes, <S%H5869><s%> because he has found <S%H4672><s%> some <S%H1697><s%> unseemly <S%H6172><s%> thing in her, <S%H3789><s%> that he shall write her a bill <S%H5612><s%> of divorce, <S%H3748><s%> and give <S%H5414><s%> it in her hand, <S%H3027><s%> and send <S%H7971><s%> her out of his house. <S%H1004><s%>
When she is departed out <S%H3318><s%> of his house, <S%H1004><s%> she may go <S%H1980><s%> and be another <S%H312><s%> man <S%H376><s%>'s wife.

If the latter <S%H314><s%> husband <S%H376><s%> hate <S%H8130><s%> her, <S%H3789><s%> and write her a bill <S%H5612><s%> of divorce, <S%H3748><s%> and give <S%H5414><s%> it in her hand, <S%H3027><s%> and send <S%H7971><s%> her out of his house; <S%H1004><s%> or if the latter <S%H314><s%> husband <S%H376><s%> die, <S%H4191><s%> who took <S%H3947><s%> her to be his wife; <S%H802><s%>

her former <S%H7223><s%> husband, <S%H1167><s%> who sent her away, <S%H7971><s%> may <S%H3201><s%> not take <S%H3947><s%> her again <S%H7725><s%> to be his wife, <S%H802><s%> after <S%H310><s%> that she is defiled; <S%H2930><s%> for that is abomination <S%H8441><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Yahweh: <S%H3068><s%> and you shall not cause the land <S%H776><s%> to sin, <S%H2398><s%> which Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> gives <S%H5414><s%> you for an inheritance. <S%H5159><s%>

When a man <S%H376><s%> takes <S%H3947><s%> a new <S%H2319><s%> wife, <S%H802><s%> he shall not go out <S%H3318><s%> in the army, <S%H6635><s%> neither shall he be assigned <S%H5674><s%> any business: <S%H1697><s%> he shall be free <S%H5355><s%> at home <S%H1004><s%> one <S%H259><s%> year, <S%H8141><s%> and shall cheer <S%H8055><s%> his wife <S%H802><s%> whom he has taken. <S%H3947><s%>
No man shall take <S%H2254><s%> the mill <S%H7347><s%> or the upper millstone <S%H7393><s%> to pledge; <S%H2254><s%> for he takes <S%H2254><s%> a life <S%H5315><s%> in pledge. <S%H2254><s%>

If a man <S%H376><s%> be found <S%H4672><s%> stealing <S%H1589><s%> any <S%H5315><s%> of his brothers <S%H251><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> and he deal <S%H6014><s%> with him as a slave, <S%H4376><s%> or sell him; <S%H1590><s%> then that thief shall die: <S%H4191><s%> so you shall put <S%H1197><s%> away <S%H1197><s%> the evil <S%H7451><s%> from the midst of you. <S%H7130><s%>

Take heed <S%H8104><s%> in the plague <S%H5061><s%> of leprosy, <S%H6883><s%> that you observe <S%H8104><s%> diligently, <S%H3966><s%> and do <S%H6213><s%> according to all that the priests <S%H3548><s%> the Levites <S%H3881><s%> shall teach <S%H3384><s%> you: <S%H6680><s%> as I commanded them, <S%H8104><s%> so you shall observe to do. <S%H6213><s%>
Remember <S%H2142><s%> what Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> did <S%H6213><s%> to Miriam, <S%H4813><s%> by the way <S%H1870><s%> as you came forth <S%H3318><s%> out of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>

When you do lend <S%H5383><s%> your neighbor <S%H7453><s%> any <S%H3972><s%> kind <S%H4859><s%> of loan, <S%H935><s%> you shall not go into his house <S%H1004><s%> to get <S%H5670><s%> his pledge. <S%H5667><s%>
You shall stand <S%H5975><s%> outside, <S%H2351><s%> and the man <S%H376><s%> to whom you do lend <S%H5383><s%> shall bring forth <S%H3318><s%> the pledge <S%H5667><s%> outside to you. <S%H2351><s%>
If he be a poor <S%H6041><s%> man, <S%H376><s%> you shall not sleep <S%H7901><s%> with his pledge; <S%H5667><s%>

you shall surely <S%H7725><s%> restore <S%H7725><s%> to him <S%H7725><s%> the pledge <S%H5667><s%> when the sun <S%H8121><s%> goes down, <S%H935><s%> that he may sleep <S%H7901><s%> in his garment, <S%H8008><s%> and bless <S%H1288><s%> you: <S%H6666><s%> and it shall be righteousness to you before <S%H6440><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> your God. <S%H430><s%>

You shall not oppress <S%H6231><s%> a hired servant <S%H7916><s%> who is poor <S%H6041><s%> and needy, <S%H34><s%> whether he be of your brothers, <S%H251><s%> or of your foreigners <S%H1616><s%> who are in your land <S%H776><s%> within your gates: <S%H8179><s%>

in his day <S%H3117><s%> you shall give <S%H5414><s%> him his hire, <S%H7939><s%> neither shall the sun <S%H8121><s%> go down <S%H935><s%> on it; <S%H6041><s%> for he is poor, and sets <S%H5375><s%> his heart <S%H5315><s%> on it: <S%H7121><s%> lest he cry against you to Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> and it be sin to you. <S%H2399><s%>

The fathers <S%H1><s%> shall not be put to death <S%H4191><s%> for the children, <S%H1121><s%> neither shall the children <S%H1121><s%> be put to death <S%H4191><s%> for the fathers: <S%H1><s%> every man <S%H376><s%> shall be put to death <S%H4191><s%> for his own sin. <S%H2399><s%>

You shall not deprive <S%H5186><s%> the foreigner, <S%H1616><s%> or the fatherless <S%H3490><s%> of justice, <S%H4941><s%> nor take <S%H2254><s%> a widow <S%H490><s%>'s clothing <S%H899><s%> in pledge; <S%H2254><s%>

but you shall remember <S%H2142><s%> that you were a bondservant <S%H5650><s%> in Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> and Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> redeemed <S%H6299><s%> you there: <S%H6680><s%> therefore I command you to do <S%H6213><s%> this thing. <S%H1697><s%>

When you reap <S%H7114><s%> your harvest <S%H7105><s%> in your field, <S%H7704><s%> and have forgot <S%H7911><s%> a sheaf <S%H6016><s%> in the field, <S%H7704><s%> you shall not go again <S%H7725><s%> to get <S%H3947><s%> it: <S%H1616><s%> it shall be for the foreigner, for the fatherless, <S%H3490><s%> and for the widow; <S%H490><s%> that Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> may bless <S%H1288><s%> you in all the work <S%H4639><s%> of your hands. <S%H3027><s%>

When you beat <S%H2251><s%> your olive tree, <S%H2132><s%> you shall not go over the boughs <S%H6286><s%> again: <S%H310><s%> it shall be for the foreigner, <S%H1616><s%> for the fatherless, <S%H3490><s%> and for the widow. <S%H490><s%>

When you harvest <S%H1219><s%> your vineyard, <S%H3754><s%> you shall not glean <S%H5953><s%> it after <S%H310><s%> yourselves: <S%H1616><s%> it shall be for the foreigner, for the fatherless, <S%H3490><s%> and for the widow. <S%H490><s%>

You shall remember <S%H2142><s%> that you were a bondservant <S%H5650><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt: <S%H4714><s%> therefore I command <S%H6680><s%> you to do <S%H6213><s%> this thing. <S%H1697><s%>
